skill.name: Senior Security
skill.description: Comprehensive security engineering skill for application security, penetration testing, security architecture, and compliance auditing. Includes security assessment tools, threat modeling, crypto implementation, and security automation.
skill.summary: Security engineering toolkit for penetration testing, threat modeling, and compliance auditing
skill.author: Claude Skills

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate security engineering skill containing documentation and skeleton Python scripts. All 58 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The analyzer misinterprets TypeScript code block comments (//) as shell backticks, argparse descriptions as cryptographic algorithms, and standard dev commands as malicious access. No actual exploit code, command injection, or data exfiltration patterns exist. The skill contains only placeholder documentation and template scripts.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at references/cryptography_implementation.md:20
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Line 20 contains TypeScript code block with // comments, not backticks. Static analyzer misinterprets documentation code examples as shell execution.

content.user_title: Implement security architecture and penetration testing
content.value_statement: Secure applications from design through deployment with automated threat modeling, security auditing, and penetration testing workflows. This skill provides comprehensive security engineering capabilities for identifying vulnerabilities and implementing defensive patterns.
actual_capabilities: Automated threat modeling and risk assessment workflows
limitations: Scripts are templates requiring custom implementation for specific use cases
Does not include live vulnerability scanning tools
Requires security expertise to interpret results and implement fixes

use_cases.title: Threat Modeling Projects
use_cases.description: Systematically identify and mitigate security threats in new or existing application architectures.

use_cases.title: Security Code Reviews
use_cases.description: Conduct security audits and identify vulnerabilities in codebase before production deployment.

use_cases.title: Audit Documentation
use_cases.description: Generate security documentation and evidence for compliance requirements like SOC 2 and ISO 27001.

prompt_templates.title: Threat Model Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-security skill to create a threat model for my application architecture. Analyze the components and identify potential security risks with mitigation strategies.

prompt_templates.title: Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a security audit on my codebase using the security_auditor tool. Identify vulnerabilities, classify by severity, and provide remediation recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my proposed architecture against security patterns from the senior-security skill. Suggest improvements for authentication, authorization, and data protection.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance Evidence
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate security documentation using the senior-security skill that demonstrates compliance with security controls for audit purposes.

output_examples.input: Create a threat model for my microservices architecture with authentication service, database, and API gateway
output: Trust boundary identified between client and API gateway
Authentication service requires mutual TLS and rate limiting
Database connection should use encryption at rest and in transit
API gateway needs input validation and request throttling
Recommended mitigation: Implement OAuth 2.0 with JWT tokens

output_examples.input: Audit my codebase for common security vulnerabilities
output: 2 instances of insufficient session timeout configuration
Missing SQL injection protection in 1 database query
Recommendations: Use parameterized queries, implement proper error handling

best_practices: Run security audits during CI/CD pipeline before deployment to catch issues early
Document all security decisions and architecture choices for audit compliance
Combine automated scanning with manual security code reviews for comprehensive coverage
anti_patterns: Skipping security reviews due to time pressure increases technical debt
Focusing only on known vulnerabilities while ignoring design flaws
Treating security as a final checkpoint rather than continuous process

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill provides patterns and guidance for TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Go, Swift, and Kotlin projects.

faq.question: Does this skill perform live penetration testing?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides frameworks and templates for penetration testing workflows but does not execute active exploits.

faq.question: Can this skill generate compliance reports?
faq.answer: Yes, it can generate documentation and evidence suitable for audits including SOC 2 and ISO 27001 requirements.

faq.question: Do I need additional tools for vulnerability scanning?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill provides the framework and methodology. For active scanning, integrate tools like OWASP ZAP or similar.

faq.question: How do I integrate security checks into my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Run the security_auditor script as a pre-deployment step in your CI/CD workflow to catch issues before production.

faq.question: What is the difference between threat modeling and security auditing?
faq.answer: Threat modeling is proactive design analysis to identify threats before building. Security auditing reviews existing code for vulnerabilities.
